intro: Lasiosiphon humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
